Constructor Detail

AdvResultSetMetaData

public AdvResultSetMetaData(java.lang.String myAlias,
                            ColumnMetaData... columnMetaDatas)
This constructor is meant to be used with "fresh" tuples, i.e. not concatenated ones or the like that may already have mappings with multiple aliases on the same column.

Parameters:
myAlias - alias of the Cursor belonging to this metadata, null if none
columnMetaDatas - the metadatas of each column

AdvResultSetMetaData

public AdvResultSetMetaData(java.lang.String myAlias,
                            boolean fillMappings,
                            ColumnMetaData... columnMetaDatas)
This constructor may be used if the mappings can't be trivially generated, but will be done manually after creating the Object with this constructor (e.g. when concatenating metadata etc).
However if fillMappings is set to true, the mappings will be generated.

Parameters:
myAlias - alias of the Cursor belonging to this metadata, null if none
fillMappings - if true, mappings (alias.name->index) will be generated. If false, you have to do that yourself afterwards
columnMetaDatas - the metadatas of each column
See Also:
concat(AdvResultSetMetaData, AdvResultSetMetaData)

AdvResultSetMetaData

public AdvResultSetMetaData(java.sql.ResultSetMetaData rsm,
                            java.lang.String alias)
This constructor creates an AdvResultSetMetaData object from a simple ResultSetMetaData. Should be used when wrapping JDBC-ResultSets in AdvTupleCursors

Parameters:
rsm - a ResultSetMetaData, e.g. from a JDBC-ResultSet
alias - the alias of the new AdvTupleCursor wrapping the ResultSet
Method Detail

getAlias

public java.lang.String getAlias()

concat

public static AdvResultSetMetaData concat(AdvResultSetMetaData first,
                                          AdvResultSetMetaData second)
Returns a concatenatenation of two AdvResultSetMetaDatas

Parameters:
first - 1. AdvResultSetMetaData
second - 2. AdvResultSetMetaData
Returns:
(first AdvResultSetMetaData)++(second AdvResultSetMetaData)

concat

public static AdvResultSetMetaData concat(AdvResultSetMetaData first,
                                          AdvResultSetMetaData second,
                                          java.lang.String newAlias)
Returns a concatenatenation of two AdvResultSetMetaDatas with a new Alias for the resulting metadata.
Please note that only columns with unique names (within this metadata) can be accessed by "newAlias.name", so you might want to rename some column's names (or use the old alias to access them).

Parameters:
first - 1. AdvResultSetMetaData
second - 2. AdvResultSetMetaData
newAlias - the alias of the newly created metadata. null if you don't want an additional alias.
Returns:
(first AdvResultSetMetaData)++(second AdvResultSetMetaData)

clone

public AdvResultSetMetaData clone(java.lang.String newAlias)
Returns a "clone" of this MetaData, but there are new mappings for the new alias. (newAlias.nameOfSomeColumn -> index)
Please note that there will (and can) be no mapping for duplicate names (You may still acess them with their original Alias, though).

Parameters:
newAlias - the new alias
Returns:
an AdvResultSetMetaData with the given alias

getIndexByAliasAndName

public int getIndexByAliasAndName(java.lang.String alias,
                                  java.lang.String name)
Returns the index of the element that was originally in the tuple/cursor with given alias and has the given name.
Note: The default name of an attribute in a Tuple wrapping a primitive Type (or it's wrappers like java.lang Integer), e.g. from a Cursor, is "value".

Parameters:
alias - the tuples/cursors alias
name - the attribute's/element's name
Returns:
logical index in this tuple (resp. tuples of this cursor) or -1 if not found

getIndexByAliasAndName

public int getIndexByAliasAndName(java.lang.String aliasname)
Returns the index of the element that was originally in the tuple/cursor with given alias and name. (Format: alias.name or just name, but then the name has to be unique within this Cursor/Metadata)
Note: The default name of an attribute in a Tuple wrapping a primitive Type (or it's wrappers like java.lang Integer), e.g. from a Cursor, is "value".

Parameters:
aliasname - the tuples/cursors alias and name (alias.name)
Returns:
logical index in this tuple (resp. tuples of this cursor) or -1 if not found

getIndexByName

public int getIndexByName(java.lang.String name)
Returns index for given name or -1 if the name is not found or not unique (i.e. the name exists several times with different aliases)

Parameters:
name - the attributes name
Returns:
index of the column for the given name or -1 if not found

getColumnMetaData

public ColumnMetaData getColumnMetaData(int column)
Returns the ColumnMetaData of the given column

Parameters:
column - the index of the column which's metadata is to retrieved
Returns:
ColumnMetaData for column with given index

addMappingAliasNameIndex

protected void addMappingAliasNameIndex(java.lang.String alias,
                                        java.lang.String name,
                                        int index)
Adds a mapping from alias and name to logical index within a tuple to this metadata.
Should probably not be used much outsite this class..

Parameters:
alias - the alias of the tuple/table containing the element at index
name - the name of the element at index
index - the logical index of the element within tuples containing this metadata

createColumnMetaData

public static ColumnMetaData createColumnMetaData(java.lang.Class<?> cl,
                                                  java.lang.String name,
                                                  java.lang.String alias)
Returns an appropriate ColumnMetaData-object for the AdvResultSetMetaData. All relevant information can (hopefully) be extracted from the class of the Object in this column and the columns name

Parameters:
cl - a column represented by this metadata will contain an Object of this class
name - the Columns name
Returns:
an appropriate ColumnMetaData
